t: “Do*pn you think this to be just? Do*ld you say, ‘It is my right before God,’
that*ln you ask, ‘What advantage have I? How*ld am I better off than if I had sinned?’
I*ln will answer you and*ld your friends with you.
Look*ln at the heavens, and see; and*ld behold the clouds, which are higher than you.
If*ln you have sinned, what do you accomplish against him? And*ld if your transgressions are multiplied, what do you do to him?
If*ln you are righteous, what do you give to him? Or*ld what does he receive from your hand?
Your*ln wickedness concerns a man like yourself, and*ld your righteousness a son of man.
“Because*pn of the multitude of oppressions people cry out; they*ld call for help because of the arm of the mighty.
But*ln none says, ‘Where is God my Maker, who*ld gives songs in the night,
who*ln teaches us more than the beasts of the earth and*ld makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?’
There*ln they cry out, but he does not answer, because*ld of the pride of evil men.
Surely*ln God does not hear an empty cry, nor*ld does the Almighty regard it.
How*ln much less when you say that you do not see him, that*ld the case is before him, and you are waiting for him!
And*ln now, because his anger does not punish, and*ld he does not take much note of transgression,
Job*ln opens his mouth in empty talk; he*ld multiplies words without knowledge.”
